description: [allAfrica] 600 million. This is the alarming number of Africans who still live without access to electricity. This figure h ighlights the scale of the continent's energy challenge. However, with an estimated growth rate of 3.7% in 2024, Africa is displaying an economic vitality that stands in stark contrast to the much more moderate rate of 0.9% expected for the European Union.
title: Africa: Energy And Digitalization In Africa - Accelerating Without Compromising The Future

description: [The Herald] THE Africa Golf Club, founded by Intra-Africa trade entrepreneur and one of the continent's business golf content creators, Mr Chad Chawanda, has officially launched the Africa Wednesday
title: Africa: Africa Golf Club Launches Wednesday Business Golf Day

description: [Premium Times] The 47-year-old has been very intentional about her craft and has had every new production better than the former
title: Africa: Funke Akindele Crowned West Africa's Box Office Queen As 'Everybody Loves Jenifa' Grosses N1.8 Billion

description: [UN News] Synthetic drugs are rapidly transforming the global drug trade, fuelling an escalating public health crisis, according to the UN administered International Narcotics Control Board (INCB).
title: Africa: 'Rapid Expansion' of Synthetic Drugs Reshaping Illicit Markets, UN Anti-Narcotics Body Warns

description: [UN News] Dramatically evolving geopolitical tensions amid "dangerous nuclear rhetoric and threats" are a stark wake-up call for States to take action to support the legally binding atomic weapon ban treaty, UN Secretary-General António Guterres said on Monday.
title: Africa: 'Dangerous Nuclear Rhetoric and Threats' Trigger Stark Wake-Up Call - UN Chief

description: [Oxfam] Commenting on news today that the US has confirmed the termination of USAID funding for multiple life-saving projects in the Democratic Republic of Congo, Oxfam Country Director Manenji Mangundu said:
title: Africa: Oxfam Reaction to USAID Funding Cuts in DRC

description: [allAfrica] Kigali, Rwanda -- "We never said no. We just said, 'How?' What drove us, the most important thing that drove us, were the children. These were lives that we could change."
title: Africa: 'No Money, No Programs' -  Funding the Future of Smiles in Africa

description: [CAF] South African football legend Benni McCarthy has been unveiled as the new head coach of Kenya's national men's football team, the Harambee Stars.
title: Africa: South African Legend Benni Mccarthy Unveiled As New Kenya Coach

description: [VOA] Riyadh, Saudi Arabia -- The U.N.'s special representative on sexual violence in conflict said that when military spending goes up worldwide, it increases conflicts that mainly affect women and children.
title: Africa: NGOs Seek New Sources of Aid As Traditional Donors Reduce Funding

description: [New Times] At least 54 countries have successfully eliminated one or more neglected tropical diseases (NTDs), marking significant progress in the fight against these preventable illnesses.
title: Africa: Experts Call for Stronger Strategies to Eliminate NTDs in Africa

description: [New Times] It is a busy Monday at Nyakabingo Mine in Rulindo District as over 2,000 workers engage in various roles, from office duties to mechanised underground mining in search of wolframite, the host mineral for tungsten.
title: Africa: Inside Rwanda's Tungsten Mine Which Is the Leading Producer in Africa

description: [IFJ] Jemima Beukes, who currently serves as Secretary General of the Federation of Southern African Journalists (FeSAJ) and Acting Secretary General of the Namibia Media Professionals Union (NAMPU), both of which are affiliated with FAJ and the IFJ, has dedicated herself to exposing critical national issues, holding power to account and ensuring that the voices of the people are heard. However, her commitment to independent journalism has made her the target of brutal workplace repression by the Network Media
title: Africa: African Journalists Condemn Ongoing Victimisation and Repression of Journalistic Rights and Press Freedom

description: [ENA] Addis Ababa, -- The First High-Level Learning Event on the Food Systems Resilience Program (FSRP) for Eastern and Southern Africa will kick off tomorrow, from March 4 to 6, 2025, in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia.
title: Southern Africa: First High-Level Learning Event On Food Systems Resilience Program for Eastern, Southern Africa to Be Held in Addis

description: [The Conversation Africa] For decades, scientists have been learning more about the diets of early hominins, particularly their reliance on plants. Yet we still don't know when these ancestors of humans started eating meat.
title: Africa: When Did Our Ancestors Start to Eat Meat Regularly? Fossilised Teeth Get Us Closer to the Answer

description: [UN News] As 120 conflicts rage around the world from the DR Congo to Gaza and from Sudan to Ukraine, UN human rights chief Volker Türk on Monday urged the international community to step up to defend fundamental freedoms and the institutions founded to promote them - not least from "unelected tech oligarchs".
title: Africa: At a Time of War, Nations Must Stop Global Order From Crumbling - UN Rights Chief
